title.narrative: Stories of Solidarity - development of digital online workshop and increasing the coverage of the activity

description.narrative: Stories of Solidarity -project offers workshops for 5-9 graders and upper secondary school students. This project offers workshops and online-workshops around Finland. Workshops are instructed by instructors who are trained during the project. Workshops wi ll be instructed in Finnish and Swedish for all target groups.Stories of Solidarity -workshop makes young people realise that everybody in the global North and South can affect positively to our world and carry global responsibility through solidarity. You ng people will get to know their peers living in the Global South and learn what kind of acts of solidarity they have carried out in their own communities. Getting to know acts of solidarity helps Finnish youth to find similarity between them and their pee rs on the other side of the world. Young people will also be encouraged to think about global responsibility through their own choices and actions. They will be challenged to think how a person community society and a country can show solidarity towards ot hers. The workshops will also challenge the participants? media literacy so that they understand how to think more critically about the images offered by the media. The main goals of the project are:- Children and young people?s understanding towards globa l responsibility and solidarity will e expand- Children and young people?s media literacy will expand- Teachers competences for media skills and dealing global issues will expand- School visitors are able to instruct workshops professionally and inspiratio nally Main goals will be reached by developing existing workshop concept and material in a way that workshops can be instructed for 5-6 graders. Workshop concept and material will also be developed for Swedish speaking groups. Long distance workshop will b e developed by using Skype and Seppo -platform. In addition teachers will learn new ways to deal with global issues and they become familiar with the material so that they can use it in their future lessons. Evaluation will be done during the project. A gr ant of 78 871 has been granted by MoFA to this two-year project.
